title: Physical Partnership
description: Reflect on your overall physical connection

questions.text: I feel good about our physical connection overall.

therapeutic.rationale: Overall positive feeling about your physical connection captures the cumulative effect of many small moments. This general sense matters for relationship satisfaction.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different overall feelings indicate different experiences. The less satisfied partner's concerns need attention without defensiveness.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared positive feeling about physical connection is a relationship strength.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How do you feel about your physical connection overall? What affects that feeling most?

questions.text: Physical closeness is a source of connection, not stress, in our relationship.

therapeutic.rationale: Physical closeness should ideally add to relationship wellbeing. When it becomes a source of stress, the dynamic needs attention.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If physical closeness creates stress for one partner, explore what's stressful. Pressure? Mismatched needs? Unresolved issues?
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared experience of physical closeness as connecting is a positive foundation.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: Is physical closeness more often connecting or stressful? What affects that?

questions.text: I feel my partner and I are on the same team when it comes to our physical connection.

therapeutic.rationale: Feeling like teammates in physical connection means you're working together rather than against each other. This partnership approach solves problems collaboratively.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner doesn't feel like teammates, explore what creates that. Is there blame? Different goals? Sense of being adversaries?
therapeutic.whenSame: Mutual sense of teamwork creates collaborative approach to physical connection.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: Do you feel like teammates in your physical connection? What would strengthen that?

questions.text: Our physical connection reflects the love in our relationship.

therapeutic.rationale: When physical connection reflects emotional love, the two strengthen each other. A disconnect between love and physical expression deserves attention.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If physical connection doesn't reflect love for one partner, explore the gap. Is love present but not showing physically? Is physical present but disconnected from emotion?
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared sense that physical connection reflects love integrates both dimensions of intimacy.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: Does your physical connection reflect the love you feel? What would align them more?

questions.text: I feel hopeful about our physical connection going forward.

therapeutic.rationale: Hope for the future of your physical connection provides motivation to work on it. Hopelessness often leads to giving up.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner lacks hope, explore what's taken it. Specific concerns? General pessimism? Understanding the hopelessness helps address it.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared hope about your physical future creates motivation for continued investment.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What makes you hopeful—or less hopeful—about your physical connection going forward?
